content:
Hello. I just made my first cargo PR https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/pull/9702
Can someone please kick off CI so it would run tests? Thanks.
Looks like someone beat me to it. Welcome to to project!

Thank you! @Eh2406 Do you have time to help me understand the desired behavior for https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/issues/9518 ? Do we want this error to happen only in dev dependencies or not? My current PR is breaking build::self_dependency test which has [dependencies.test] path = "." and I don't know if that is ok or not.
Here are the CI failures after my first commit: https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/pull/9702/checks?check_run_id=3094933575

I think those are all errors anyway. Changing how it errors seems fine to me. But we should probably update the tests to demonstrate more complicated cyclic dependencies.
@Eric Huss what do you think?
Thanks for feedback. I pushed several commits and would like to restart the CI, if possible. All tests pass for me locally on MacOS.
I thought we had this set so once you got approval it stayed approved. But I gave it a approval again.
I think with the current setting it requires approval until someone has gotten a commit in.
Until then, you still count as a new contributor, and every CI run requires approval.
There's been discussion of improving that setting for the rust repositories.

@Pietro Albini Was this option enabled org-wide?

image.png

We are still getting new PRs from new contributors that have accounts that are years old that are requiring approval. (https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/pull/9702)
updated the org-wide setting to just new users
I thought I enabled it, maybe forgot tho
thanks for the ping, and thanks mark for handling it!
